Reviews.Title: Blacberry Torch 9860
Reviews.Author: usmcaf88
Reviews.Content: Best Blackberry I have owned to date.  World traveler, it has worked at every location, no dropped calls or problems with connecting to different service providers.  Uses the T-Moblie SIM state side and an international SIM when traveling.  Currently using a country specific SIM, connects everytime. (Text and Calls)  The phone is very responsive and easy to use.  Tethered to my 64G Blackberry Playbook, and also linked to my computer, keeps files, dates, appointments and reminders with no issues.  Blackberry is on the right path with this product.  Easier to access the battery, SIM and memory chip with the one touch removal of the rear case.  The only issue encountered was a one time drop and the rear case disconnected and the battery shot out, since, I purchased the skin and no futher issues.

Reviews.Title: The best blackberry ever

Reviews.Content: I have to say RIM got it right with this model. This is the best blackberry ever! Sleek design, big screen with excellent display...Share review

The only one problem is that it doesn't works on my country (I'm from Ecuador) in 3G, but the rest, it works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great phone but they lied about the battery
Reviews.Author: The laughing fox
Reviews.Content: One star for a great phone? Harsh, but I think it is a disgrace that Blackberry can lie so blatantly on their published phone specifications about their battery life......They quote 15 days standby time: it's about 15 HOURS.....They quote 6.5hrs talktime: you might get an hour......Normal use, with screen permanently dimmed, wifi and blutooth switched off, GPS switched off, all apps closed, 50 min talk time, is half a day (longer if you don't actually use it).Others who are familiar with smartphones probably won't be surprised. I haven't had a smartphone before, I trusted the specifications. I was conned. How can they get away with lying on their spec sheets? What do we believe if we can't believe the spec sheets? One star is punishment for lying.Other than that it's a great phone. Probably 4 stars. I wouldn't have been so angry if they'd said up front that's what the battery life was. Why don't they instigate something like the standard 'urban' 'extra urban' fuel consumption standards on cars, and put their competitors' products through the same tests so they're not disadvantaged. Be the first to be honest and win market share Blackberry!Comments on other things:First rate typingThe ability to type fast on the touch screen, particularly with the well thought out "reduced keyboard", is phenomenal, and immediately intuitive - no learning curve. This is the number one feature for me.... but why does the keyboard automatically switch to multi-tap in email fields on contacts? I hate that. Change it please! I have to type emails in another field and cut and paste them into the email field which is faster.The layout and intuitive nature of all the controls is excellent.Camera is okbut why not let the intuitive button on the side of the phone be the photo-taking button? Then you could use it with one hand. And why does it sometimes just refuse to take a picture when you are pressing the button for a great, and fleeting shot? Stress! And of course the battery gets low and it won't take a picture then either. And why not allow zoom during video?Dialling is greatbut with two niggling, easy to solve flaws. (1) Currently you have 4 totally unnecessary keystrokes just to start typing the person's name when you open the phone app. Easy to fix: allow user to set which tab comes up first (keypad, recent or contacts), and on contacts tab open with cursor in the search box and the keyboard up. (2) Weird thing where if you start typing a person's name, they appear on the screen, and you hit their name on the screen, it jumps up and dials the person at the top of the screen. Maybe this is just a bug in my phone. It's damn irritating!Needs a force-quitOS needs an app like task manager in windows. There are nearly 60 hidden apps you can't delete running permanently in the background! Surely they aren't all necessary, and they use battery. An app showing app specific battery consumption and allowing you to force quit apps would be a dream.

Reviews.Content: Cuidado con las bandas 3G, las especificadas en el página no son las mismas que vienen con el producto, el color tampo coinicide y los 4Gb de almacenamiento solo reconoce 2.5Gb no se a que se debe esto?. Atención gente de Venezuela si vas a usar este telefono con Digitel no funcionaría en 3G solo puedes usarlo con Movistar en 3G. A mi me estafaron en ese sentido las bandas con que promocionan el celular no son las mismas y la capacidad interna de alamacenamiento (4Gb) tampoco. Muy lamentableBeware of 3G bands, specified in the page are not the same that come with the product, the color buffers coinicide 4Gb storage and 2.5Gb not only recognizes that this is so?. Attention people of Venezuela if you use this phone with Digitel would not work on 3G Movistar can only use it on 3G. I really cheated in that respect the bands that promote the cell are not the same and the internal capacity of Disk Storage (4GB) either. very sad

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: K.W. McCabe "kwmccabe"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone because I'd finally decided I wanted a touchscreen. I was a little leary about getting a BBM at first because the old versions take FIVE MIN to turn on--but I was pleasantly surprised.The newest version of the Torch doesn't take nearly as long as old versions to turn on (although it still takes a little longer than other phones) and its features are nice.The screen is sensitive and I usually turn it on its side to press keys in order to reduce typos.It works well with 4g speed and videos from youtube look awesome on its screen.I use it for everything- email, text, twitter, fb. The only thing that doesn't work well on this phone is Google+.I have to say I absolutely love this phone, and would be lost without it :)

Reviews.Author: Diegos.
Reviews.Content: Todo en orden y en excelente estado, el proveedor es muy serio y llego en el lapso de tiempo acordado.

Reviews.Title: For BES?BB Enthusiasts ONLY  *Updated
Reviews.Author: 1magine "1magine"
Reviews.Content: If you are a BB die hard, or on a BES this is one of the 3 top of the line BBs.  If you're not - it's a waste of money.  Any other phone in this price class has a glass screen (plastic?  really RIM?); a front facing camera no BB has this; at least 8 gigs of application storage (256 megs after OS load is a joke; WIFI hot spot....  In fact there are so many devices in this price range that have dual core CPU's and 4G that one wonders how much the profit margin is on this phone.  Compare this to the 9900 - a really nice glass screen (though tiny) aluminum band around the midlle.  The raised plastic buttons make this thing as ugly as sin.*So the plastic has held up pretty well - but still not as nice as glass.As for software.  * Software updates, addittions to older programs (BBM now has voice calls) and new programs BB Navigation, have brought the software side up to where it should have been 2 years ago.  Just in time for the release of the Z-10.It's blackberry 5.0 + 2.  Nothing really new or creative here.  The web browsing is better and almost on par with the other platforms.  But there will be NO THEMES for OS7, the new hardware broke the theme studio and it can not be fixed.  There will be no upgrade to BBX -which will be out in less than a year, and as such there will be little in the way of app development for this platform. It has no flash support, and it never will.  Most of the web animation and video is still flash based and so this device will never give you the full web experience.Performance - *Again - OS fixes have really helped,but its underlying programming is this devices downfall.  Much like its true predecessor the Storm line (which by the by had a much better fit and finish), the device has its moments.  And it can be fast, but it is still based on a Java Kernel that was built around the time Reagan/Bush was in the White House.  Try to load a Java heavy web page and the phone will hour glass.  For e-mail, facebook, texting and accessing some music or pictures - this device works just fine.  But I need to ask why would one spend the same money for a an Alien Ware gaming PC as for an e-machines bargain bin PC?

Reviews.Title: A great full touch screen smartphone from BlackBerry, perfect size, fast processor
Reviews.Author: Texan
Reviews.Content: This is a real good smartphone from BlackBerry.  It is the perfect size, and has a very fast processor with little lag.The battery lasts well over a day, with usage including imo (Skype), watching music videos off of the memory card I installed,email, some web browsing, and the occasional phone call.The browser is very good.  The screen is a bit smaller than some other full screen smartphones,but the benefit of that is the whole phone is smaller and very pocketable.Also since the battery is removable, I can carry a spare and not worry about running out of juice.(You can't remove an iPhone's battery)So far I like this more than my Bold 9900 which for some reason uses up more power than this.It has never frozen up so I'm not sure why other reviewers say it does.I'm guessing user error and they probably never updated the software like they are supposed to.My only complaint about the BB OS, is that there is no official Skype App, and no Netflix App for it.Hopefully the new BB10 phones coming out in 2013 will take care of that short fall.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Smart Phone
Reviews.Author: IslandDave
Reviews.Content: Blackberry Torch 9860 Unlocked Phone with 4GB Internal Memory, Blackberry OS 7, 3G and 5MP Camera - International Version (Black)This was my 3rd Blackberry.I like Blackberry Phones for the same reason they became so popular in the first place; the QWERTY keyboard and simple utilitarian software designed for push email and Blackberry messaging along with web site access is easy and quick to use.This model is almost pure touch, there are however, four main physical keys and a track pad at the base of the touch screen. Some people may have wished for the phone to be completely touch in order to streamline it more like the Galaxy or the Iphone it is trying to compete with.On my phone I had issues with these key functions lagging and locking especially the go-back key. When I returned the phone under guarantee I was told it was not repairable and the technician at the service centre admitted this model suffers from this issue frequently.I used the guarantee refund voucher to buy a more expensive Galaxy Series 3 issued by the service agency to me for the Unrepairable Blackberry. My wife uses the Galaxy and I have gone back to my old QWERTY Blackberry.I get the general idea, particularly from the huge discount this model often retails for, (mine was about half its original price) that this phone has not been a great success for Blackberry.

Reviews.Title: NOT THAT GREAT!!!!! THE ORIGINAL WAS BETTER!
Reviews.Author: Meri
Reviews.Content: I have the torch 9810 and just recieved the new all touch torch and I hate it. I miss the blackberry keyboard and the phone to me is just ugly and I don't particularly like the new OS 7.I am going to stick to my sleek slider 9810 and sell this disappointment soon.If you love the blackberry friendliness and the very smooth keyboard don't get the new torch go for the original. The 9810 is cheaper anyways. And it looks and functions 10 times better!!

ProductInfo.Features:
3.7-inch TFT LCD display
GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900; HSDPA 900 / 1700 / 2100; High-resolution 800x480 WVGA pixel color display
5MP camera, 720p HD video recording, Flash, Continuous auto focus, 4X digital zoom (still images only), Geo-tagging
Processor: QC 8655 1.2 GHz, Built-in GPS functionality, Wi-Fi, 4 GB internal memory, Expandable up to 32 GB with a microSD memory card
Talk time: Up to 6.2 hours (GSM), up to 5.9 hours (UMTS). Standby time: Up to 11.6 days (GSM), up to 11.8 days (UMTS)
